Hei Chan wrote:
> Hi Bjarne,
> 
> Thanks for your time.
> 
> Are you saying that RejectDecideRule actually
> dis-allow DNS-lookup and fetching robots.txt?
> 
> If I put PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule right after
> RejctDecideRule, the *only* effect will be allowing
> Heritrix to do DNS-lookup and fetching robots.txt?

RejectDecideRule REJECTs everything -- it is used to establish the 
default decision. It is then up to later rules to ACCEPT what you want 
and what is necessary for proper crawler functioning.

PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule ACCEPTs all URIs that have been reached via 
a 'P'-notated hop. (That is, the last character in the 'hops-path' is 
'P'.) The only URIs so notated are DNS and robots URIs that were 
scheduled as necessary prerequisites of other URIs.

Sometimes PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule is unnecessary (because perhaps 
all necessary URIs are already being accepted by other rules), but it 
never hurts.

- Gordon @ IA

> Thanks in advance.
> 
> Cheers,
> Hei
> --- Bjarne Andersen <bja@...> wrote:
> 
>> You can't crawl anything if not allowing DNS-lookup
>> and fetching of robots.txt. This is exactly what
>> PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule does.
>>
>> best
